summary.overview: Steve Jobs (1955â€“2011) was a visionary entrepreneur and design perfectionist who revolutionized the personal computing, animated movie, music, phone, and tablet publishing industries.

earlyLife.family: Born in San Francisco and adopted by Paul and Clara Jobs
earlyLife.upbringing: Grew up in Silicon Valley, developing an early interest in electronics
earlyLife.education: Dropped out of Reed College and traveled through India

careerTimeline.event: Co-founded Apple Computer with Steve Wozniak in his parents' garage
Launched the Macintosh, introducing the graphical user interface (GUI) to the masses
Ousted from Apple due to internal power struggles
Pixar released Toy Story, making Jobs a billionaire
Apple acquired NeXT, bringing Jobs back to the company
Resigned as CEO in August and passed away weeks later

companies.name: Apple Computer
companies.firstSuccess: Apple II ignited the personal computer revolution
companies.achievements: One of the greatest corporate turnarounds in history

companies.name: NeXT
companies.outcome: Acquired by Apple in 1996 for its operating system

iconicProducts.name: Macintosh
iconicProducts.impact: Introduced the graphical user interface (GUI) to the masses

iconicProducts.name: Apple Store
iconicProducts.impact: Fundamentally changed how consumers bought technology

iconicProducts.name: iTunes
iconicProducts.impact: Fundamentally changed how consumers bought media

leadershipStyle.description: A mix of charisma, marketing genius, and demanding leadership style
leadershipStyle.focus: Slashing projects and focusing on industrial design
leadershipStyle.philosophy: Obsession with merging the humanities with technology to create products that were intuitive, beautiful, and functional

summary.legacy: His legacy remains defined by his obsession with merging the humanities with technology to create products that were intuitive, beautiful, and functional.
